definition: to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: Be thou faithful until death: and I will give thee the crown of life.
sentences.chinese: 你应当忠信至死，我必要赐给你生命的华冠。

sentences.english: And he gave her the upper springs, and the nether springs.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲就把上泉下泉赐给她。

sentences.english: And God gave me muscles and brains to work.
sentences.chinese: 上帝赐给我臂力和智力去工作。

sentences.english: And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，惟有你是神，你也应许将这福气赐给仆人。

sentences.english: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
sentences.chinese: 你把旌旗赐给敬畏你的人，可以为真理杨起来。

sentences.english: God heard their complaint and promised to supply them with both meat and bread.
sentences.chinese: 神听见他们的怨怼之声，于是承诺赐给他们食物。

sentences.english: So like you, want to use you have given me memories of heating.
sentences.chinese: 于是想你，想用你曾经赐给我的回忆取暖。

sentences.english: 4May he give you the desire of your heart and make all your plans succeed.
sentences.chinese: 将你心所愿的赐给你，成就你的一切筹算。

sentences.english: And now, O LORD, you are God, and you have promised this good thing to your servant.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华啊，惟有你是神，你也应许将这福气赐给仆人。

sentences.english: And what about the perfection provided to worshipers from the heavenly sanctuary?
sentences.chinese: 那么从天上的圣所赐给敬拜之人的完全又是如何呢？

sentences.english: and gave to us the ministry of reconciliation;
sentences.chinese: 又将劝人与他和好的职分赐给我们。

sentences.english: Fairy gave her boundless money then.
sentences.chinese: 仙女于是赐给了她无穷的财富。

sentences.english: Be faithful, even to the point of death, and I will give you the crown of life.
sentences.chinese: 你务要至死忠心，我就赐给你那生命的冠冕。

sentences.english: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 他向你求寿，你便赐给他，就是日子长久，直到永远。

sentences.english: Science only bestows the grandest favour on those who concentrate on it.
sentences.chinese: 科学只把最高的恩典赐给专心致志地献身于科学的人。

sentences.english: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.
sentences.chinese: 我看见那站在神面前的七位天使，有七枝号赐给他们。

definition: variant of 賜予|赐予[ci4 yu3]
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
